roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_0:
§r-------§oShops§r-------Shops are a vital part of progression in this data pack. They are located in the Cosmic Dome and allow you to spend skillpoints on upgrades, abilities and classes.
To the to the right of this lectern is a dummy shop that sells a useless upgrade for 0 skillpoints so
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_1:
you can get a feel for how shops work.
There are 4 different types of shops. The first one is simply called an "upgrade shop". These work exactly like the dummy shop. They sell upgrades for a flat price until you reach the max level.
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_2: The next type of shop is called a "progressive shop". These don't show their price in the text display above them, but instead only in the title above your hotbar. That's because their price increases as you increase the level of that upgrade.
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_3: The third type of shop is a "class shop". These simply sell classes. The main difference to other shops are that they only have one level, and that once you unlocked them, you can right click them to either select or de-select the class. This will further explained in the next
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_4:
lectern.
The final shop is called an "ability shop". These sell active abilities and act like progressive shops in that their cost depends on the upgrade level. These shops always have a maximum level of 3. To bind your ability item to the ability displayed
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_5: in the shop, simply click the shop while holding the corresponding ability item. This will be further explained in the next book.
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_6:
-----§oShop Tiers§r-----
You may have noticed a lock above the dummy shop. Locks display the shop tier. A shop tier indicates the highest level of that upgrade, which is increased by increasing the tier of the shop. This is done by defeating bosses. With a golden lock, the shop is fully locked,
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_7: preventing you from buying any upgrades. Silver locks allow you to buy some upgrades, bronze locks allow you to buy most of them, and shops without locks above them are fully unlocked.
roguecraft.tutorial.shops.page_8:
-§oRemoving Upgrades§r-
If you want to decrease your level of an upgrade, simply hold the "Upgrade Remover" item and right click the appropiate shop §lwhile shifting§r.

IMPORTANT: This will not return any skillpoints, so be careful!
roguecraft.tutorial.vanilla_changes.page:
---§oVanilla Changes§r---
The upgrades you'll obtain while playing this data pack are very powerful, so to balance this out, the game is significantly more difficult.
The first change is that your starting health is reduced to just 5 hearts instead of the usual 10. This will make survival a lot

more challenging early on, so it might be a good idea to invest into health upgrades in the early game.
The second change is much more impactful. Since you can unlock armor, tool and weapon upgrades in the hub, all those recipes are disabled. You'll be unable to
roguecraft.tutorial.difficulty_level.pag:
---§oDifficulty Level§r---
The difficulty level is one of the most significant difficulty additions in this data pack. It will show up at the top of the screen and slowly go up, until it reaches a new level.
On difficulty level 1, nothing changes compared to vanilla. However, once the difficulty level hits 2,

all mobs will receive buffs. This ranges from giving armor to zombies and skeletons, to increasing the blast radius of creepers, to even giving all mobs that can hold items a totem of undying.
Once the difficulty level reaches 10, mobs will no longer receive buffs, but

instead the player's health will go down by 2 hearts every time the difficulty multiplier increases past level 10. So for level 11, you will lose your first 2 hearts, then again for level 12, again for level 13, and so on. This goes on until all players reach only one heart of health.

Due to this change, you are encouraged to progress quickly if you want to beat the game. It is still very much possible to beat as even an inexperienced player, but feel free to learn some strategies from speedruns to gain an advantage.

roguecraft.book.giant.1:
The analysis of Mana, Souls and Life Force has yielded some interesting results: They are one and the same, only from different sources, and in different forms.
With our extended knowledge of magic, we are now experimenting with new types of footsoldiers. The
roguecraft.book.giant.2: evokers in particular are turning out especially promising, but we are even experimenting with duplication of biomass, though this has proven to be quite the challenge. So far, this only appears to be a visual change.
roguecraft.book.hideout.1:
We lost.

As much as I hate to admit it, we lost.

I suppose we managed to seal him away, but still, this isn't over, far from it. We could all one day just die, and the seal would break. We need to make sure that this never happens.
roguecraft.book.hideout.2:
Speaking of death, Jean isn't doing too good. There's this purple corruption spreading inside of her, so we're considering locking her away inside of the end as well.

At least it's a place she's familiar with, but it still pains me to do this.
roguecraft.book.hideout.3:
This is all my fault. I wanted to get this done as soon as possible, but we simply weren't strong enough.
Or maybe...

"A king is no match for a god". Maybe there's truth to those words, I suppose I should've taken him more seriously
roguecraft.book.hideout.4:
Either way, now all we can do is wait, until the end of time.

I'm starting to feel some of that corruption brewing up inside me as well, perhaps it's time for me to leave the others.

Farewell, my friends.
I am sorry.
roguecraft.warning.repair: <%s> Some important entities have been killed. Starting repair of hub. Please do not use '/kill @e' or similar commands
roguecraft.warning.incompatibility:
<%s> Incompatible mods or clients detected, such as lunar client.
Please create a new world from scratch on a vanilla or slightly modded instance, or you will run into more severe errors later on.
Please check the current incompatibilities on the wiki:

https://roguecraft.wiki.gg/incompatibilities
roguecraft.tutorial.introduction.page_0:
----§oIntroduction§r----
Welcome to §lRoguecraft§r, a roguelite data pack. If you already know what a roguelite is, feel free to skip to page 4. A roguelite is a variation of the roguelike genre, where the world is randomly generated, and the game loop is
roguecraft.tutorial.introduction.page_1: separated into multiple runs. In roguelikes, if you die, you lose all of your progress, while in roguelites, you’re allowed to keep some of that progress upon death, which in this case includes unlocking permanent upgrades that will massively help during future runs, with the current
roguecraft.tutorial.introduction.page_2: ultimate goal of defeating the ender dragon.
roguecraft.tutorial.introduction.page_3:
------§oTutorial§r------§r
You are currently located in the tutorial, where you can learn all about the data pack. It is recommended to at least take note of the crafting recipes on the left of this lectern. If you’d rather experience it for yourself, you will get info messages to
roguecraft.tutorial.introduction.page_4:
help you during your journey whenever needed. You can disable those too if you want by running the command '/trigger toggle_info_messages'.
If you need help finding points of interest during runs, make sure to buy the loadstone compass upgrade.
roguecraft.tutorial.introduction.page_5:
There is also an official wiki, which you can get to by %s.
Whatever you end up doing, I wish you the best of luck with Roguecraft. Have fun!
roguecraft.tutorial.skillpoints.page_0:
-----§oSkillpoints§r-----
Skillpoints are the most important resource in Roguecraft. They can be used to buy upgrades, abilities and classes in the hub. These are obtained in a multitude of ways, like looting structures, gaining advancements, or most importantly, crafting,
roguecraft.tutorial.skillpoints.page_1: using the recipes behind this lectern. Keep in mind that upon starting a new run, you will lose all unspent skillpoints, so make sure to use them right away.
roguecraft.tutorial.skillpoints.page_2:
----§oSkill Gems§r----
These are the core crafting ingredients for skillpoints (the item in the middle of the recipes behind the lectern). These are obtained by increasing your xp level, making them increasingly difficult to obtain. If you manage to lower your xp level, you will NOT gain another skill gem by reaching a level you've already reached. For example, if you lower your level from 21 to 20, you will not gain a second skill
roguecraft.tutorial.skillpoints.page_4:
----§oMob Essence§r----
This crafting ingredient can be obtained by killing any mob. The rarer or stronger that mob is, the better the mob essence it will drop. Upon killing a certain amount of specific mobs, their soul will become exhausted, meaning they will only drop low value mob
roguecraft.tutorial.skillpoints.page_5: essence, so you’ll have to kill other mobs to gain better mob essence. This exhaustion will end upon starting a new run.
roguecraft.tutorial.vanilla_changes.page: craft tools (pickaxes, shovels, axes and hoes), weapons (swords and bows) and armor. Some notable items that you're still able to craft include the flint and steel, buckets, shields, turtle helmets, shears and fishing rods. As the game would be impossible to beat without tools,

you start with a stone pickaxe. This, in combination with some speedrunning techniques, such as building a portal with a bucket, is in theory enough to beat the entire game. Also, all tools obtained through upgrades are unbreakable.
Next up, even though the recipes are

disabled, some of these items will still show up in loot chests or villager trades. This will be further explained in "Mid-Run Upgrades".
Lastly, some parts of the game have been modified to work better with the core loop of this data pack, mostly including structures.
roguecraft.tutorial.abilities_and_classe:
------§oAbilities§r------
Abilities are powerful, active spells. They can be bought in the hub, after which you have to hold one of your spell books and click the shop to bind that book to the ability shown in the shop. You have 3 spell books by default, or 4 if you choose the mage class. These will
appear in your inventory during a run you’ve bound an ability to them, after which you have to right click to cast them. Abilities have no cooldown, but require mana to be used.

------§oScrolls§r-------
Scrolls act as single use abilities and are mostly found in loot chests. These can be either normal abilities or class abilities and mostly have no cost, with a few exceptions. You can also use the copy ability to use them as many times as you want.

-------§oMana§r--------
Once you've bound your first ability, a mana bar will show up at the top of the screen. This will tell you your current amount of mana, which is the resource required to cast spells. Your mana will regenerate slowly passively until it hits the maximum.

----§oSoul Charge§r----
For the Reaper class, you use Souls to cast abilities instead of mana. Souls can be obtained by killing most mobs.
While the mana cost for each ability varies, for the Reaper class, each ability has a flat cost of 1 soul charge.

------§oClasses§r------
Classes are powerful archetypes that can be unlocked with skillpoints. They give you passive bonuses, as well as special class abilities.
You can select a class by buying them and then clicking them. If you then click them again, you will unselect that class.
You can also only select one class at a time, so choose something that works for your playstyle.

---§oClass Abilities§r---
Each class also has multiple class abilities, which are usually much more powerful that normal abilities, and are more suited towards the playstyle of each class. You can toggle between these by sneak-right clicking the class ability spell book.
Mage is an exception, having no special class abilities, instead gaining a fourth ability slot.
roguecraft.tutorial.progression.page_0:
----§oProgression§r----
Progression has undergone a massive overhaul in Roguecraft. Generally, if you need a helping hand, try unlocking the "Lodestone Compass" upgrade. This will lead you to your next objective while holding it.
roguecraft.tutorial.progression.page_1:
------§oBosses§r------
Roguecraft currently has 3 unique bosses, with more coming in the future. Defeating each of these is the main point of progression.
There is a strange room in the southern section of the Cosmic Dome. Try clicking one of the obelisks there. Perhaps their leaking souls will guide you
roguecraft.tutorial.mid_run_upgrades.pag:
--§oMid-Run Upgrades§r--
Beating Minecraft with only a stone pickaxe can be challenging, so by finding equipment like tools, weapons and armor, you’ll be able to directly upgrade your equipment. For example, if you have leather armor and pick up an iron chestplate, your
chestplate will be directly upgraded to iron, keeping any existing enchantments as well.

---§oEnchantments§r---
Finding an enchanted piece will also add its enchantments to that piece on the player. Picking up enchanted books will enchant all applicable pieces with that enchantment.
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_0:
--The Cosmic Dome--
You are currently located inside of the Cosmic Dome, the hub area of this data pack. It contains a few rooms important to progression, as well as access to the Infinite Garden.
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_1:
-----Inventory-----
While in the Cosmic Dome, you’ll have a few items in your inventory. The first few are your spell books, which you can bind to abilities by holding them and clicking an unlocked ability shop.
Next up is the "Lodestone Compass", which you’ll see in
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_2:
your hotbar upon buying the loadstone compass upgrade. This will allow you to set your desired progression route by clicking one of the obelisks in the seal room.
The “Remove” item will allow you to remove levels of an upgrade by sneak-right clicking a shop. Note
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_3:
that this will not return any skillpoints. It simply allows you to remove upgrades that you don’t want.
The last item in your hotbar is the "Start Run" item. Simply right click this item to ready up. Once all players are ready, a new run will begin.
The rest of your inventory is filled with
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_4: loadout items. By putting these into your loadout chest (located at the entrance to the upgrade area), you can customize your inventory upon starting a run. Any item not present in the loadout chest will not be given to you during a run. Duplicate items are removed upon starting a run.
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_5:
-The Infinite Garden-
This area can be accessed by exiting the Cosmic Dome through the northern tunnel. It’s meant as a side area where you can build whatever you want using the materials gathered during a run. These will appear at light beams, so called memory beacons,
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_6:
scattered throughout the Infinite Garden. Simply right click them to retrieve your items.
As you progress, you may also encounter some animals. The higher your highest ever amount of skillpoints during a single run was, the more animals you will encounter, up to 500 skillpoints in a single
roguecraft.tutorial.cosmic_dome.page_7:
run. Maybe you'll find a special soul once that happens.
If you're lost in the Infinite Garden or quickly want to return to the Cosmic Dome, type "/trigger hub_tp" in chat.
roguecraft.title.ender_dragon.subtitle: Tyrant of the End
roguecraft.title.wildfire.subtitle: Hovering Inferno
roguecraft.title.giant.subtitle: Arcane Colossus
roguecraft.speedrun.personal_best: You've reached a new personal best!
roguecraft.info_message.info_messages: %s You will occasionally get info messages like these about some of Roguecraft's features. These are recommended on your first playthrough, but you can run '/trigger toggle_info_messages' to disable them.
roguecraft.info_message.multiplayer_deat: %s You can return to the Cosmic Dome while other players are still alive by running '/trigger return_to_hub'
roguecraft.info_message.mid_run_upgrades: %s Finding equipment during a run will upgrade your starter equipment to that tier or to those enchantments for the duration of the run, all while staying unbreakable.
roguecraft.info_message.sleep: %s You can only sleep once per run
roguecraft.info_message.blue_moon: %s The blue moon appears every few nights, increasing magic potency of players and the undead alike
roguecraft.info_message.loadout:
%s The loadout shows where each item appears in your inventory at the start of a run.
To change your loadout, drag one of the outlined items in your inventory into the loadout chest.
If an item is missing from the loadout chest, it will be missing from your inventory at the start of a run.
roguecraft.info_message.lodestone_compas: %s The lodestone compass is an unlockable item that always points to your next step in progression during a run.
roguecraft.info_message.sp_loss: %s Upon starting a new run, all unspent skillpoints will be lost.
roguecraft.info_message.ability: %s To use abilities during runs, make sure to hit the shop of the ability you want with one of the spellbooks in your hotbar.
roguecraft.info_message.skill_gem: %s Skill gems are obtained when you level up and act as the main ingredient for crafting skillpoints. Decreasing your level and reaching it again during the same run will not grant a second skill gem.
roguecraft.info_message.selling: %s Removing upgrades does not return skillpoints.
roguecraft.info_message.missing_loadout_: %s Make sure to add the item you just bought to your loadout, or you won't have it in your next run! The loadout chest can be found at the entrance to the upgrade room.
%s Make sure to add the book you just bound to your loadout, or you won't have it in your next run! The loadout chest can be found at the entrance to the upgrade room.
%s Make sure to add the class spellbook to your loadout, or you won't have it in your next run! The loadout chest can be found at the entrance to the upgrade room.
%s Make sure to add the items you just bought to your loadout, or you won't have it in your next run! The loadout chest can be found at the entrance to the upgrade room.
roguecraft.info_message.missing_equipmen: %s Equipment upgrades can only be applied to your starting equipment. It will automatically be applied once you pick that starter item back up.
roguecraft.info_message.mob_exhausted: %s After killing a certain number of mobs during a single run, they will stop dropping higher tier mob essences. This exhaustion is reset every run.
roguecraft.info_message.class_ability: %s You can cycle between class abilities by sneak-right clicking the gold trimmed book

roguecraft.dialogue.raid_3: <%s> Even the evokers? Well, we still have an ace up our sleeves.
roguecraft.item.lore.false_gold: A weapon yearning for the power of a god, forged by one beneath their power
roguecraft.item.lore.hub_compass_1: Can be used in the Seal room on the obelisks
roguecraft.item.lore.hub_compass_2: Interact to set the target of your lodestone compass
roguecraft.equipment_upgrades.gold_upgra: There's no need to upgrade perfection
roguecraft.obelisk.name: Obelisk
roguecraft.obelisk.sol.inactive: <%s> You are unworthy of my presence, fool. Now begone!
roguecraft.obelisk.custos.main: <%s> I am the protector of the nether fortress. Face me at the birthplace of the blazes.
roguecraft.obelisk.custos.defeat: <%s> I was the Wildfire, the hovering inferno...
roguecraft.obelisk.tyrannus.main: <%s> I am the dragon of the end. Slay the guardian of the nether fortress if you wish to face me.
roguecraft.obelisk.tyrannus.defeat: <%s> I was the Ender Dragon, the tyrant of the End...
roguecraft.obelisk.fatum.inactive: <%s> The time is not quite right, eternal soul. I must ask for your patience.
roguecraft.obelisk.corpus.main: <%s> I am the arcane colossus, the mightiest force of the illagers.
roguecraft.obelisk.corpus.defeat: <%s> I was the Giant, the arcane colossus...
roguecraft.obelisk.anima.inactive: <%s> I reject your soul, for now. It belongs in the Garden, not shrouded in darkness.
roguecraft.obelisk.divus.inactive: • The presence of this obelisk fills you with dread.
roguecraft.reset.1300:
[%s] It is recommended to start a new playthrough for this update. Would you like to reset your progress?
[%s]
